EmailTemplate.name: SSSW Addressee 2-Way SMS No Response
EmailTemplate.subject: Australia Post - Case: {!Case.CaseNumber}
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Australia Post
Help & Support
Reference {!Case.CaseNumber}
Update for {!Case.Type} - {!Case.CaseNumber}
Hi {!Contact.FirstName},
Thanks for letting us know that the parcel {!Case.ReferenceID__c} sent to you hasn’t turned up, we know how disappointing it is when something you’re eagerly waiting for isn’t delivered on time.
A couple of days ago we sent you a text message requesting further information and we haven’t heard back from you yet.
{!Contact.FirstName}, feel free to hit delete on this email if you have received the parcel since we last spoke. Occasionally, for one reason or another, parcels can be delivered without the correct tracking updates.
If this isn’t the case and it remains outstanding, given the amount of time that’s past since the last update, we now have to declare your parcel lost in transit.
The best next step at this point is to reach out to the sender and inform them of the outcome. As you have not physically received the parcel they are best placed to assist you moving forward, in fact, if they have further questions please provide them with this case number, {!Case.CaseNumber}, and tell them to get in touch with us.
Sorry we weren’t able to get a positive result for you, and utmost apologies for any inconvenience this has caused.
Regards,
Australia Post
Nothing in this email is intended to exclude or limit any rights or remedies that you may have under the Australian Consumer Law.
